chunks.text: Webhook Integration Guide Webhook Integration Guide What are Webhooks? Webhooks let ClearPath notify your application when events occur. Instead of polling for changes, your app receives real-time HTTP POST requests. Setting Up a Webhook 1. Create an endpoint in your application (e.g., https://yourapp.com/webhooks/clearpath) 2. Go to Settings â†’ Webhooks in ClearPath 3. Click 'New Webhook' 4. Enter your endpoint URL 5. Select events to subscribe to 6. Save and test Event Types  task.created  task.updated  task.deleted  task.completed  project.created  project.archived  comment.created Payload Example { "event": "task.created", "timestamp": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z", "data": { "id": "task_789", "title": "New feature request", "project_id": "proj_123", "assignee": "user_456" } } Security Verify webhook signatures using the X-ClearPath-Signature header. Use HMAC SHA-256 with your webhook secret. Always validate signatures to prevent spoofing.
